channel.title: Windows 8
channel.description: I tried Windows 8 on a virtual machine, and saw that it's similar to Windows 7 (control panel, customisation, etc). I simply need opinions if it would be a good thing to use it. You can post pros or cons below and it could help me to choose. Thanks :)

item.title: Windows 8
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Once you get used to not having a start menu really it’s exactly the same as Windows 7. Though the new ‘start menu’ does function exactly the same if you think about it, only it’s a full screen application instead of just a popout thing.

Been using it for about 5 months now, js

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 8
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

Thanks for the info guys.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 8
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

I am currently running windows 8 and it is pain. It looks cool, but for use like what we would be using it for is horrible. I am currently having problems installing OpenGL. And I hate how they have their “App” store. Skype and other programs are full screen, so multi-tasking is a pain. Windows 8 was an utter disappointment.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 8
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Yea on a tablet/notebook it does seem like it would be good

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 8
item.dc:creator: @gothic_queen casey.
item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

I bought one of those ultrabooks on the spur a few days ago and it came with windows 8. I actually enjoy it. The apps you can download make it veru useful to me(netflix, twitter, reddit, news, weather, etc). I’ve always aimed for a clean and organized setup and feel like it accomplishes it well.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 8
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

I tried the beta, I was honestly very underwhelmed. I think it’s quite pointless. I prefer Windows 7, and dislike the tablet feel of Windows 8.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 8
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

The design is pretty poor for PCs in my opinion because of how it takes advantage of mobile devices, which don’t quite work well with PCs (a lot of extra mouse movement). Stick to Windows 7 for your computer.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 8
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

Really depends on what you like, but it really isn’t as bad as everyone says it is. You just need to take the time to get used to it.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 8
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

It’s incredible for mobile devices but for regular computers…just no

not that I can talk! xp4life

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Acorn1 Acorn_
item.description:
@Acorn1 wrote:

My sister got one yesterday, returned it.
Too much of a hassle.
